sentences.en: Entering the 1990 s, Chinese symphonic creation found itself in the doldrums.
sentences.cn: 进入90年代之后, 我国交响音乐创作的状态有些寂寥.

sentences.en: From 1957 to 1962, symphonic creation became even brisker.
sentences.cn: 1957年一1962年间, 交响音乐创作呈现出更为活跃的局面.

sentences.en: He prefers opera to symphonic music.
sentences.cn: 他喜欢歌剧胜过交响乐.

sentences.en: His works include operas, symphonic, choral and chamber music.
sentences.cn: 他的作品包括歌剧, 交响乐, 合唱和室内乐.

sentences.en: In fact, when the symphonic stars align, classical music concerts make for quite brilliant theatre.
sentences.cn: 事实上，当那些交响明星们整装登场之时，古典音乐会也是场绝伦的表演。

sentences.en: In symphonic writing he is the master craftsman.
sentences.cn: 在交响乐曲的创作上,他堪称技艺大师.

sentences.en: Marks the development from straight - ahead thrash metal to Metallica's classic sound, incorporating more symphonic elements.
sentences.cn: 标志着由直白的鞭挞金属乐向“金属乐队”的经典乐风拓展, 包含了更多的交响乐元素.

sentences.en: Nature's symphonic world was drowned by man's industrial cacophony.
sentences.cn: 大自然的和声世界被人类的工业噪音淹没了.

sentences.en: Of course, anyone knows that it is impossible to play a symphonic work with just three strings.
sentences.cn: 当然，每个人都知道，只用三根弦来演奏交响乐是不可能的。

sentences.en: Right now , we play music in Gothic Metal , Melodic Death Metal and Symphonic Metal styles.
sentences.cn: 目前的风格为哥特、旋死和交响金属.

sentences.en: Symphonic concerts abound in the bigger cities.
sentences.cn: 在较大的城市中经常上演交响乐演奏会.

sentences.en: The orchestra had been planning a British symphonic celebration with Hickox for 2010, and a Britten celebration for the Olympic year, 2012.
sentences.cn: 乐团正与希考克斯一 起计划2010年的英国交响乐盛典，还有2012年奥运年的布里顿庆典。

sentences.en: There can be a luxury in our bodily movements, in the movement of a symphonic poem.
sentences.cn: 一首音韵和谐的诗歌有放佚的表现;我们身体上的动作也可以有放佚的表现.

sentences.en: This kind of vigor and conception is just like a unique and vast symphonic epic.
sentences.cn: 这气势、这意境、宛如一部不同反响、恢弘壮阔购乐学的交响史诗.

sentences.en: Zheng Xiaoying has performed more than 1000 opera and symphonic concerts.
sentences.cn: 郑小瑛指挥过超过1000场的歌剧和交响音乐会.

words.tran_cn: 交响乐的；交响性的；和声的

trans.tran_en: Symphonic means relating to or like a symphony
